Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Z G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service is very good. The center of Rome should be between 30 and 45 minutes. The rooms are very clean. We took one room, we got a big bed that was a good and a very small bed that was a travel bed, and very bad. Ukupno mišljenje je da je hotel dobar osim ako uzimate triple room.

Reviews.Title: “Away from center, but Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MLSreality
Reviews.Content: A 4**** hotel for USD $40 for a single, including free wifi and breakfast. Unheard of. And while it is away from the center, there are no crowds, interesting places nearby (Quartiere Coppede), and the bus gets you to the center in short order. Breakfasts are very good, the staff is helpful. The hotel is either new, or newly renovated. My only complaint was the safe was too small for a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Tayfuns
Reviews.Content: It is a good place to stay as the hotel is very nice and clean.its a small hotel but the rooms are a good size,recently renovated,friendly and welcoming staff ,good service.top notes to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: PeterFran
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and found the hotel to offer excellent value for money.Rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast good and staff welcoming and helpful.Buses into town depart nearby and continue until late.We bought a 7 day pass to use on all city transport -v. economical. We often returned to hotel for hottest part of day and returned to town later. Bus goes to Termini where there is a Metro station - fine in daytime, but avoid at night. When returning, get off at Metro station before and walk to Termini(v.close) Hotel is about half an hour from Termini and so quieter at night .

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Anna T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was out of the city center but super easy to catch a bus and go to the train station from there buy a ticket to get on the red tour bus that goes around alllll day to all the main attraction spots that you want to see.. u get off and walk do whatever then go to a stop that says "open bus" thats where the bus picks up and drops of from..its all around the town or Rome so just look at the map they hand on the bus. The hotel is amazing!! very clean and the shower is nice pressure and clean everything was just great.. the guy working the reception desk hes awesome and I cant believe I forgot his name :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Like_travelling_08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nites during our recent trip to Rome. It is located a little outside of the city which is safe and nice, the bus stop is 4 mins walk from the hotel, and takes approx 20 mins to reach the city center depending on the traffic (bus ticket costs 1 euro). The room is spacious, clean, and equipped with modern amenities. Staff is very helpful, nice and speaks fluent english. Breakfast is awesome. Staying in this hotel makes our trip to Rome very enjoyable. Strongly recommend this hotel, and look forward to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures look better then the reality and too far from the main part of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: travelingpurdy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the airline package deal. It was in my price range, a 4 star hotel, the pictures looked good and it said it was close to the city center reachable by a 20 min bus ride. The reality is, it is about a 45 min bus ride to the main bus station and then from there you can hop on another bus to take you anywhere in the city center in 20 minutes. The hotel itself in my book would be about 2.5 maybe 3 stars, without seeing others to compare. The single room was small, twin bed, the walls needed to be painted, ugly orange blanket and the shades did not work properly. Now, the breakfast they provided (granted it was free) was pitiful. I had the only thing that looked good which was a bowl of corn flakes with warm milk, if you got there quick enough cold milk. There were hard pastries, warm yogurt, a fruit basket, watery scrambled eggs and what looked like a meat soup passing for a bacon product maybe. This hotel is not located in a good place. No resturants near by, only little pastry places where to shop workers maybe spoke a little english. I would not recommend this hotel because after spending 7 days in Rome as a solo traveler the bus got tired, the breakfast sucked and the hotel not in a good spot to go back to your room to put your tired feet up. I did alot, let me tell you alot, of walkig. It would have been nice to go back to your room and put your feet up. Once your back, your back. Unless you want to spend another hour on the bus to get back to the main area. The only good thing about this hotel was the friendly staff. they were nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, powerful shower, very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: OrientalStar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a little outside of the city in a residential area. To go into the city we used the buses, bus stop is about 200m from hotel, basically a short walk, and the bus ride to main station takes about 15-20 minutes which is pretty good. Bus ticket costs about €1, pretty good price too. We had a ensuite double room, the bed was 2 singles put together, but we didn't feel the gap at all. The bed was really comfortable, the size of super-king size, which was very spacious. It was quiet. It has air-condition, which is a must-have in Rome. Bathroom is clean, the best thing is the power shower in a good size cubicle, best shower I ever had! We both enjoyed the powerful shower inmensely. Facilities in the room include a safe, which is very handy. A mini fridge. A phone on a desk and a TV that we could only find 1 english channel - BBC world news, but it didn't bothered us so much. What is missing is tea/coffee making facilities. And no slippers were provided. There are night stands with lamps on each side of the bed. Very clean, modern room. The room was made up everyday, though they didn't vacuum the floor during our stay. The complimentary breakfast was limited but decent enough. There were scramble eggs, boil eggs, bacon, ham and salami, yogurt, horrible bread, but 3 different types of croissants, butter and jam, and cereals. Americano coffee and tea were also available. We found out on our last day that you can request the waiter to make proper coffee such as cuppocino and lattes for you :( I would say the breakfast was alright. Now come to the helpfulness of stuff, overall they were friendly and helpful, I had called reception for extra pillows and they were brought up to us. On my last day, I had asked the reception to call my transfer company for confirmation, and it was done for me. The only problem I had was on my first day there, I came down to the reception as I had some questions, to find her chatting away outside on her cellphone for at least 20 minutes even though there were 2 people sitting there who obviously wanted her help. May be she was on her break but there was no other stuff there at that moment. There is also free internet access in the lobby (1pc). I could also use my iphone with the free WIFI in the room, just ask the reception for the password. All in all, it was a very pleasant experience with the hotel. If we were to return to Rome, we would definitely stay there again. Would also recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: tatalunya
Reviews.Content: It's a bus ride from the central bus station, and a 14.00 euro per person train ride to the airport. A very pleasant stay. Clean room, helpful staff, very nice hotel. (Shame the fridge wasn't working).

Reviews.Title: “Hiden gem”
Reviews.Author: T0mt0m101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Staff were friendly and very helpful, they gave us directions and sugestions on how to get about the city. The room was spot on, clean and well decorated. The shower was massive. The location of the hotel was good, away from the city center but easy to get into the city by using the bus (84 Bus) which takes you right in to the center. Public transport is cheep, and can get you close to the big sights. we used the metro to get to the vatican. We also walked alot. Finding that it was easy to map read around the city,(tip: you dont need to shell out on expensive maps, the hotel gave us a paper map, looks a bit like a kid drew it but does the job) Food at the hotel was great, and kept us going for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: dixwimby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is some way out of the city. about 20 minutes. it suited by purpose and was close to where I wanted to be. A very nice friendly clean hotel. it has buses which go to the city just 30 metres away. there some bars and resturants 50 to 100 metres away and 200 metres away several more in a different direction. The breakfast was simple but enough to get you started. cold meats cheese honey crossants cornbread boiled eggs fruit juice coffee hot water and fresh fruit. my room was very clean. the tv had 3 channels bbc world, qatar and sf german. the bathroom was clean and bright the only down side was the shower head needed replacing as it was broken. if you need a good clean place to put your head cant go wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Shakira777
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family for a week in July and absolutely loved this place. The room (triple) we had was spacious and beds comfortable. The room was located on the top floor of the hotel & it provided us with a spacious terrace were we were able to have 'picnics' or sunbathing sessions undisturbed. There are shops not far away from the hotel were you can buy local products and bus stops that take to the Rome center. It is very convenient and we found it better than staying in the Rome center as we were able to try pizza in places were only the locals know and go to. There is a park nearby with a bar were lots of young people gather every night for a drink. Good if you like drinking a beer outside. The staff is extremely helpful and breakfast, although nothing exceptional, will set you out for a day. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “an experience”
Reviews.Author: Tiba79
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently, and found it very comfortable. the staff are really friendly and helpful. they are always willing to help and answer any questions you may have. it is not near the center of Rome, but it has good transport connections. The breakfast is ot geat, and can be better, however there is a lot to chose from. There are alot of really great local shops around, so one can never be hungry. w loved the staff, the transport connections and the fact that it shows real Rome, not just the center of the city. the people in the are are so friendly and nice. altough they do not speak alot of English, they try very hard to understand, and give a very good and honost service. If I ever go back to Rome, I will definitly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: LESIUS_LENHADUS
Reviews.Content: For those that are looking for a nice, modern, comfort and affordable place to stay, this is your hotel. Modern deco and nice beds. Silent location. There are a nice restaurant nearby. Markets at walking distance. To reach Rome center you just have to take a bus at a bus stop 50 meters of the hotel. When coming back, the bus stops 20 meters of the hotel. Nice staff, excellent breakfast. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: AndrewtLondon
Reviews.Content: I agreed with all the comments on Trip Advisor- it is a bit far for comfort but the 90 bus is really frequent and the 84 goes straight into the Historic Centre. We stayed there as everywhere else was full with John Paul pilgrims. The air con is a bit noisy, the walls are a bit thin and the drains smell a bit but the bed is huge and the TV too. Surprisingly the only TV channels are Italian plus one French news channel. On the plus side there are a string of fine restaurants a few metres away including the superlative Taverna dei Briaganti.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic out of the way hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: city-girl1983
Reviews.Content: This really is a great little hotel if slightly out of the way a little, yet in easy reach of the center of Rome via a 20-40 minutes (depending on the time of day) bus ride, with a stop just 5 minutes walk away. The bus tickets can be purchased in the local shop on the way to the stop, please remember to validate your tickets for bus and train journeys, we didn't when we first arrived and having never travelled to Italy before didn;'t know any different, we got a fine, to the value of £35 each! The hotel (like may others I presume) other a tour map, which once you are the in center of Rome you are in walking distance of many of the famous attractions. The rooms are really nice, very clean, yes a little small, but who needs a suite when you are on a city break and getting out to explore the attractions? Travelling in September it was warm, and the air-con was used, cannot complain on the sound. A good variety are breakfast, cereals, pastries, bacon and egg, toast with butter, jams and nutella, and yogurts, nice selections of tea and coffee orange juice too. We stayed two nights and had fresh towels every day, the bathroom is of a goos/high standard, something I always check for when I go away. Bed's were comfortable and we got a good sleep everynight. There was always some one at the Hotel reception, ready to help if needed. What else can I say but a really great hotel and if I were to go back to Rome wouldn't def go back to the Aniene!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice & small rooms, very loud”
Reviews.Author: abc069
Reviews.Content: - rooms are small but nice - hotel is very loud because of air con (?), walls are clairaudient, you understand every word of the next room. Forget sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great.”
Reviews.Author: Attillia
Reviews.Content: Location: Somewhat out of place from the city center but its easy enough to get into town. There are two bus stops within a 5 minute walk. From the center of Rome, expect to pay €15-25 (night rate). Staff: Great, very helpful, very friendly. Made no fuss about a late check out. Breakfast: Apart from a few pots of expired yogurt and the same variety every day, it was a great breakfast. The staff were more than happy to prepare a tray full for an in room service. Rooms: The TV channel selection is poor but if you switch to analogue, you'll get some English channels. Very good size, very clean. Only issue here was that double beds are joined twins so it ended up separating. Room cleaning was done every day and was spotless. WiFi: Free and reasonably fast. All in all and great stay at a very decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I like it, but its a bit far”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy85London_UK
Reviews.Content: I'm keeping this short and sweet. I liked the hotel, i think the taxi hotel transfer is a rip of, your better of getting a taxi from the airport for 40 euro or a coach to the termini and getting the 84 or the 90 to the hotel, a little well hidden especially at night. The room was ok, small but clean, the bathroom was very clean and i had good showers there. The tv channels could of been a little more variety, for english speakers, but oh well. The customer services is really good, especially the lady, she's sooooo sweet. All in all i would stay in this hotel if it was central. The breakfast was ok, i was stuffed. Rome Italy is one of the best cities i've ever been too, so enjoy xxx

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing start but proved to be an adequate base”
Reviews.Author: princess0122
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here during a trip to Rome to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday. I emailed the hotel in Italian, prior to our stay, requesting the nicest room possible and if there was anything else they could do to make the stay extra special. On arrival, we were given a room with twin beds, (not a double as booked), the room was dusty, noisy and shabby with stains on the wall above the bed! I complained at reception and mentioned my email but was told that there were no more free rooms available as we had checked in late in the afternoon. The receptionist somehow managed to find an available room 20 minutes later which was larger and cleaner, so thanks to her for saving the day! Although not in a central location, we were aware of this and didn't mind the 25 minute bus journey into the centre. Wifi and the breakfast at the hotel was good and would meet most peoples needs. The hotel bar was non-existent though, a few bottles on shelves but the lights were off! In summary, this hotel is not a 4 star, it's 3 years old and in real need of a lick of paint and scratched furniture replaced. My advice, pay more and stay central!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, and too far from the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Love
Reviews.Content: DON’T STAY HERE!!! I only give 2 stars to this hotel because the staff was friendly and helpful, and because they have free internet. They also were very punctual with wake up calls. Otherwise, the place is horrible! The claim that the hotel is a 4* is laughable; I would not give them even 3*. First of all, it is FAR! Realistically, it takes about an hour to get from here to anywhere in the center of the city. I usually don’t mind using public transport if it saves me money, but buses in Rome get packed to the gills even on weekends and you will have to make at least one transfer on your way, so using public transportation here is not a good option, especially if you spend the whole day walking around and don't need strain and stress of riding in a packed bus for an hour. It is not feasible to return to the hotel in the afternoon, relax and go out to eat in the evening. Secondly, you can not call out, both internationally and within Italy, even using a calling card! They blocked phone lines, and I was not able to get an explanation as to why. This is unacceptable, and is a failure to provide a basic service. Also, midway through my stay something happened and I could not get connected even with the front desk, and had to come downstairs whenever I needed something. Third, you can not set a thermostat to your liking. The default setting was full blast heating for some reason, and I had to sleep with open windows, which let in mosquitoes. Also, sound insulation is insufficient, and I was getting woken up by people walking in the hallway. Fourth, the room and bed are tiny. Sheets are well worn and have holes. They give only one towel, but it is changed daily and was nice and clean. The shower is OK, also. However, they do not provide shampoo. Some rooms are even tinier than the one that I got! Fifth, the rooms are not clean. There is a lot of dust, and they don’t get vacuumed regularly. Also, the hotel is very far from the airport. You will have to pay E65-70 to get there. Taxi fare to the train station is about E20. The chair is very uncomfortable. Breakfast was blah. There is no clock in the room. There is no suitcase stand. They don’t provide a pen and a notepad either. The only non-Italian channel is BBC. There is only one elevator in the building. I could go on, but you get the picture! I would strongly recommend to look for another place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Distant hotel from the center for good money.”
Reviews.Author: Licence2kill
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff. room was spotless and cleaned up properly every day (everytime i found my pyjamas was nicely folded on the bed, which is nice:-). good and filing breakfast(american), including even scrambled eggs and fried bacon. price was good. The negative is the location pretty far from the center. the ride downtown takes a bit of time, so the hotel was not appropriately chosen for my purpose to have to be in the center every morning on time. but for those who are just on their holidays and dont bother about time so much(and dont plan to keep running back and forth) it can be good choice. another negatives i should mention are pretty thin walls and not very sitting door, which were not soundproof. for those who got light sleeping i recommend earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good food, helpful staff. Overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveandDitheYorkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aniene for 5 nights and found it a good experience. Although arriving very late (due to strikes in France)we were welcomed nicely and allocated a comfortable and spacious room with comfortable bed, good bathroom and nice and quiet etc. Each morning we had a good breakfast of hot (warm) food or a good buffet selection to choose from. We needed to get our return flights sorted out and the staff were more than helpful with printing boarding passes etc. Found two good places to eat in the evenings close by (300m max) which provided varied menus at better prices than central Rome. These were the Taverna dei Briganti and the Ristorante Pizzeria Citta Giodino. You need to travel by bus north out from Termini for approx 20 mins on either the #90 or #84 but we felt this no problem and in fact enjoyed the experience evn when it was a little crowded. Would recommend Aniene to people who like to get value for money and who don't necessarily want town centre locations

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aniene in Agus 2010 and we found it a very clean, modern and comfortable experience. Although it is away from the City Centre the 90 bus which is just at the bottom of the road takes you straight into the Centre in 15-20mins and costs just 1 euro. (you can then use this ticket for 75mins to hop on other buses or for 1 metro ride! Great value...we spent hardly anything on getting around Rome..its very cheap to use their public transport. The Reception Staff and the cleaners were really friendly and helpful but I must say after a week we had yet to see a smile from the admin staff .. need to cheer up if you ask me! The breakfast was a good Continental selection of Meats, Cheese, Pastries, cereals,croissants, coffee and tea. There was also eggs and bacon if you wanted it. The maids cleaned your room everyday and fresh towels and complimentry toilettries were put out. They even tidied up my stuff which I had left lying around!! To sum it up Aniene is a fab modern hotel..extremeley clean..good value for money..east to get to from airport and city centre..but if you want the hustle and bustle of the centre outside your hotel door then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “I would have never stayed there if I knew they have racist staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nath1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aniene is a small, nice hotel but some of the staff are very rude and racist to my opinion. I stayed there for three weeks for business because it was 10 mn ride from my workplace. After the first week, the reception clerk called me and said that I should start paying my bill right now, because my credit card (Corporate Amex card by the way!) might not work on my last day! I didn't know what to think. But I went ahead and gave him the credit card and he charged it. I am black and I don't to think that people act toward me in a certain way because of my color, but in this case I believe that this guy was plain racist. It is sad that based on your color, people can make assumptions, and actually act upon those assumptions. I will not return to this hotel, I wish I paid almost 2,000 euros to another institution! So people do not encourage this behavior by staying at that place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: MissWilliams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bright, modern, clean with good and enthusiastic service. Though it is out of the touristy areas, we found the connections between the hotel and Termini very easy with the 90 express buses. It took 15-20 minutes to get into the centre, the buses ran frequently, and upon talking with the staff, there will be a Metro station 200 m away in the near future.we enjoyed our stay, and really appreciated them pointing out local restaurants that they frequented. Two blocks away were Mediterreneo and the Taverna del Brigante. The food was great and much cheaper than the restaurants in the centro storico. Thanks again, we would stay here and happily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations. RECOMMENDED! :o)”
Reviews.Author: CP1602
Reviews.Content: As two students on a budget, we were looking for somewhere clean and comfortable to stay, and were quite happy to take a bus ride into the town centre, so Hotel Aniene was perfect - the express bus (90 or 90D) gets you to the Termini Station in about 20 minutes. If you jump on the 84 bus, you can get very close to the Palatine Hill and the Colosseum, or the Piazza Venezia. Buses are very cheap too - €1.00 for a single trip, but we opted for a 7-day unlimited bus pass which cost just €16.00, particularly handy as tickets cannot be bought on the bus! The room was very comfortable, and whilst not huge there was plenty of space for the two of us. Had it not been for the air conditioning in the room, I don't think either of us would have survived the trip! It was WONDERFULLY cold in the room - we came back to the Hotel most days during the hottest part to cool down and take a rest. The service we received cannot be faulted in any way. All the staff were friendly and smiling, all spoke English (a great relief to us both!) and were always very happy to help. When the cleaning service forgot to leave us bath towels, fresh ones appeared within minutes of asking, despite the fact the cleaners had long since left! When it comes to the morning, breakfast was served between 7 and 11, and consisted of a large range of continental pastries, meats, cheese, cereals, yoghurts and fruit. For those that wanted it, bacon and eggs were also on offer. Let's also not forget to mention the coffee, which although great in the hotel, was fantastic wherever you went. And very cheap! Near the hotel are plenty of pasticcieria, supermarkets and bars, and a few restaurants just up the road which were recommended by reception staff - La Taverna dei Brigante is well worth a visit - just arrive with a large appetite! All in all, we had a great holiday, and the hotel was always a pleasure to return to at the end of a hot day. Would recommend to anyone happy to hop on a bus, especially those on a budget! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but to far from everything”
Reviews.Author: JGITZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really nice, but we felt it was a little out of the way from everything. The hotel has a modern feel, mostly decorated with Ikea stuff, which was ok buy us. Unfortunately we didn't really know which area would be the best to stay in and we ended up picking Hotel Aniene for its price and its look. Don't get me wrong, if you don't mind taking a bus, which is only at the end of the block maybe a 8 to 10 minute walk to the Termini Station and the from there you will most likely take the Metro then it is ok, but we felt we spent way too much time doing this. The other problem is that if you plan on staying out after midnight you have to find another form of transportation to get back to the hotel as the Metro stops at midnight but there are night buses just they are a little trickier to figure out and don't run all the frequently. The breakfast was great, not a lot of stuff but tasty, scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruit, cereal, toast and such. They did have free internet which is always a plus. The bathroom was good, a big shower which you don't find all that often in Italy. The bed was ok, but the room was kinda tight, not that that really matters cause who really spends lots of time in their room anyways! Would I stay there again, probably not just due to the fact of the location and there is not much around it when it comes time to eating and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and modern, friendly staff a short bus ride away”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travelitaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and modern in the middle of a residential area in which you can find local cafe's, a grocery store and restaurants. Myself and my mother stayed in this hotel for three nights in a room with two twin beds. The rooms are small but clean, the only issue i had was the noise from the street as our window faced the front of the hotel, im a light sleeper and so ear plugs came in handy. The breakfast is adequate with juices, coffee, meats, cheeses and of course pastries. The staff is very friendly and helpful in giving directions. To get to the hotel from the Terminal this is a 10-15 minute bus ride which runs quite frequently. The only issue we had was lugging our bags to the bus stop on the last day and hopping on the busy bus to the terminal in which we were packed like sardines and awkward with suitcases when people are trying to get out. For the price we paid we were extremely satisfied, we didn't walk around at night so not sure of the safety at that time of day. Walking around during the day was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Marvel”
Reviews.Author: alwayshi007
Reviews.Content: I was traveling solo and had no idea how to get to this hotel which is not by ane means in the city center. The neighborhood people were very kind and put me on a bus that dropped me off right in front of the hotel. It was the nicest building amidst older more "authenticly Italian" buildings. At first the location scared me but once I walked around I discoverd a little grocery store that sold Coca-Cola at half the mini bar price. There is also a convenient tabacari where u can purchase bus tickets. There were several bus stops right at the hotels door step that go into Piazza Venezia and the like. The rooms 100% modern, clean, and contemperary (the elevator speaks to you in Italian!) Comp breakfast was incredible with everything from baked goods, greek yogurt, eggs, bacon, coffee, juice, bagels, cheese etc! Deffinitely recommend this clean, citrus smelling, friendly hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Sydlisa
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is a fair way from the centre of Rome it was reasonably assessble by bus. It is in a residential area and was quite a pleasant surprise when we arrived. The hotel had obviously been renovated recently and the foyer and breakfast area were very nice.The rooms were minimalist but very large for European standards. The bed was very comfortable and overall it was a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a Rome holidays”
Reviews.Author: enona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood. Although the location outside of the city, there are 2 bus stops very close to the hotel that brings you to the city in 10/15 minutes. The rooms are clean and modern (we also had a big balcony on our reservation). If you are also travelling by car, this is a good option as there's a lot of parking on the street and it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Topgun8746
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at this hotel in January 2010, as others have said it a bit out of the way but once you get used to where the bus stops are its very easy to get into the centre of rome in about 20 mins on the number 90 bus. The Hotel itself was very clean and tidy, the staff where very helpfull, nothing was to much trouble for them. The room was a bit on the small side but we didnt spend much time in there. Free WiFi was available and we had an excellent connection as we were on the first floor. Overall i would say its a good hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the residential areas of Rome”
Reviews.Author: KC_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Initially, we thought we made a bad choice due to the location. It was in the residential areas of Rome, away from the city. The street had a bit of graffiti, and there was some scattered rubbish around. However, after the first night, we realised the neighbourhood was actually quite safe, and getting into town was convenient on the number 90 bus (straight to the railway terminal). The staff at reception were eager to help. I did notice that the walls were quite thin, resulting in me hearing other people through the night. I'll probably come back to this hotel if I'm back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!...best price/value relation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cesaralejandro4481
Reviews.Content: Its an excellent hotel, with really nice and modern rooms, it has only year and a half operating. The included breakfast buffet is specially abundant y has a wide variety of delicious food, including fresh orange juice. Nearby you can find restaurants, cafes and grocery stores where you can find lower prices than in downtown and touristic places. The staff is extremely attentive!!!....responding to all your needs in their best way, specially LUCIA SABATINI, who helped us with the best cultural and city-knowledge level that you could spect. The only thing that I would like them to have, is some spanish channels on tv, since i am from venezuela. Im still remembering my happy days there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: suitraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during our summer 2009 trip after exhaustively searched mostly expensive hotels in Rome. We first hesitated to stay in this hotel because of the location that is further outside the central of Rome. Some other reviewers have warned about this. We had never been to Rome before so that added our concerns. At the end, we decided to stay here. During our stay, we were so happy that we chose this hotel. We were impressed by the quality of the room. It was clean, spotless, stylish and modern. The ultra wide flat TV screen hangs on the wall in front of the bed. The air con was really good. In the hot summer of Rome that can easily reached 30 C degrees, the air con can be cooled down to 5 C !! Wow ! Staffs are friendly and helpful. We liked the breakfast so much. Though it was in a small dining room, the quality of the bread and bakery were so amazing and they were always fresh. They serve fresh and nice coffee to start your day. Free wi-fi internet is available, but the signal did not reach all rooms. We stayed in the third floor room and it was almost impossible to get the signal. My sister-in-law family stayed in the first floor and the signal was always good. It is true that the location is outside the heart of Rome, but it is not a real problem. Just take the express bus no. 90 which takes you directly to Rome termini station. Do not get up too late as you will cramp with other commuters in the bus. Overall, I would recommend anybody to stay in this hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I go to Rome. The hotel is perfect for our base before exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Immerse yourself...”
Reviews.Author: MRLG
Reviews.Content: We purposely booked this small hotel north of central Rome to enjoy our down time, and explore and enjoy the real neighbourhood - markets, bakeries, green grocers, etc... we were not disappointed! We really felt like Romans, busing around the morning and evenings to our little home away from home. The hotel does a great job, from its practical rooms and airy balconies (albeit some chairs/tables would get us out there more than 2 minutes), to the full range breakfast, easy-to-use wi-fi and relaxing lounge area. We knew the rooms would be small by Canadian standards, but that is the way it usually is in Europe. By no means a complaint... an observation to be aware of, if it is your first time there. Marc

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: hug91
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very modern style. Wifi doesn't work. Room very nice but maybe small.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from main tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: LGMCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our younger daughter who is a junior in college. She had been studying abroad in Spain, so we met up with her at the end of the trip and visited Rome and Paris. We were on a budget and the price of Hotel Aniene was very reasonable compared to stories I had heard and prices I had seen. I guess that's why it is so far away from the ancient ruins, the Vatican, etc. The morning breakfasts which were included in our price were adequate. The bathroom was large but lacked any counter space, towel racks, or hooks. (Maybe this is a European thing. The same was true in Seville.) Bring your own washcloths as no one knows what they are. The only room for 3 was room 501. When we got to the hotel at 10:30 pm, a hotel staff member took us up to our room. To our amazement, we went up to the 5th floor on the elevator, got off, had to walk onto the roof to the door of our room. There was no working light, and we could not see where to insert a key card. The staff member opened the door for us. We asked about replacing the light the first 2 days we were there and were told it would be done the following week. That did not help us at all. As luck would have it, the temps got into the 90's in Rome the 5 days we were there. I got a horrible migraine from it. I could hardly wait to get back to the hotel the first day so I could relax in an air-conditioned room. Too bad. The A/C was not working, and did not work for 3 days, all in stifling heat. A fan was provided, but my headache did not improve inspite of taking my meds. We did a practice run from our hotel to the Vatican the day before our actual 10:00 am tour. It took 90 minutes to get from the hotel by bus to the Vatican museum. We allotted 2 hours 30 minutes the next morning. We asked for a discount because of the lack of A/C and the missing light. We were told day after day that only the GM could take care of that, and he was in Milan. When we e-mailed him a request, he offered a voucher for a free night on our next trip. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: missskeel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aniene for 5 nights and although a little way out of central Rome is was easy enough and quick to get into the city. There are two buses the 90 express or the 36 which take you straight to the Termini from there you can walk, take another bus or get the metro to where ever you want to get to. The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful, the room was large enough for us although lacked some storage. The bathroom was large and clean. Breakfast was great and had a constant supply of bacon,eggs, meat, cereal, fruit, yogs and cakes/pastries. Loved every where i went in Rome! Will def go back and would def stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Far Far Away.......”
Reviews.Author: brijan37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far away from the city centre. rom Termini station, u need to take the Bus 90 or 90D. Its about 15-20 minutes and you will need to wait for about 15-20 mins for the bus as well. Because of this i stayed in hotel for 2 nights only instead of 4 nights and shifted to another hotel near the termini for the same price! Hotel is clean and basic. Breakfast is what you would expect. Internet was free if u had yr own lap top. Stayed on the 2nd floor and as there was no air con, had to open the windows, so it was very noisy. Also, the walk from the bus stop to the hotel is about 300 meters, and at night, it might not be safe. Overall was alright but wont be going back.......

Reviews.Title: “A Nice hotel in a wrong location!”
Reviews.Author: ann087
Reviews.Content: Hotel and area: It is a nice hotel in a QUIET suburb of Rome. The room was clean and it had the basics. The only channels in English were the MTV and BBC news. Very basic breakfast and we didn’t find any menu of what we could have ordered e.g. if you ask them, they can make you fresh orange juice or a toast. We didn’t find it out until the last day we left! There is wireless internet (you have to ask at the reception for a code) and PC with internet access at the reception, €3 for 15 mins. The walls are very thin and if you have noisy neighbours, you might suffer. There isn’t a mirror in the main room e.g. if you want to blow dry your hair. Also if you want to blow dry your hair in the bathroom, you have to use the hotel’s blow dryer because there isn’t a proper socket there. Also, there isn’t any shelf that you could put your stuff e.g. your toothbrush. I enjoyed the pressure of the water in the shower and the temperature of the room (it was quite warm). Also the beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful although they didn’t know basic things e.g. we asked for restaurants around the hotel’s area and they gave us only one which is 100 meters from there (you will pass in front of it in order to go to the hotel-you can’t miss it). We ate one night at this restaurant and the food was okay, nothing exciting. The area is very quiet and it has very few shops. This can be an issue if you want to buy something from a supermarket or pharmacy. Although we didn’t have any problem, we didn’t feel very safe in that neighbourhood after 10 o’clock (two females, early thirties). Buses: Yes, there are buses to the city centre but it takes at least 20 mins to get there and you have to wait for another 15 mins for the bus to come. So, each journey takes an average 30-45mins. When we read the other travellers’ reviews, we thought that this would be okay. However, we found out that this was the bigger issue of all. Rome is quite big with lots of attractions. If you want to spend a few hours in the centre in the morning, have lunch, then go to hotel to have a shower/relax and go out again for the afternoon/evening, this means that you have to commute for at least 2.5-3 hrs per day. We were exhausted doing that after the second day and we preferred to spend the whole day in the centre and have early nights. I assume that if you are going to spend a week in Rome or you are willing to take taxis, that might be okay. We had only five days and we wanted to see as much as possible. Taxis charge around €30-€40 from the hotel to Termini. We bought Rome Pass for 3 days. This is a good value for money if you commute to hotel twice a day. Otherwise, the cost is almost the same as the bus ticket is only €1. Rome Pass gives you free access to the first two monuments and half price to the rest of them. However, you will find out that it is hard to visit more than one per day due to the queues and lack of time. Regarding your luggage, you can leave at Termini. They charge €4 for 5 hrs. Again, that’s a good idea if you want to visit a place the last day and you don’t want to spend your time commuting between the hotel and the Termini. We were in Rome at Easter and we had an excellent time. The city is beautiful and there are so many places to explore. Make sure that you have a good street map and ask policemen for directions if you are lost (most of them speak English and are quite helpful). The hotel didn’t have to provide us with a map but they told us that they had placed an order. So, you could ask the receptionist for a map of the area. Overall, we would have preferred to have spend some extra money and have stayed a little bit closer to the city centre. It would have made our lives easier. In my opinion, hotel Aniene is a good 3 stars hotel in the wrong area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly but very minimalist”
Reviews.Author: okeydokeIOW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of April 2009 (myself, husband and teenage son). The rooms were small (1 single, 1 double) as were the bathrooms. The furnishings were very minimalistic - just a desk and bedside cabinets plus wardrobe. There were no drawers or cupboards at all although there was a safe, which is always needed. The rooms were both very clean and the staff friendly, although the air conditioning in neither room worked and despite trying, the staff couldn't fix it so we were very hot at night. Our cab driver had a lot of trouble finding the hotel, but location-wise it is ideal with the bus running every 15 minutes from the end of the road and the fare being only 1 euro each. There is a small menu here but the food is pre-packaged, convenience food directly from the freezer to the microwave. There is a free internet service which is a big plus point as some hotels charge high prices for this.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: little_ozzie_one
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and got a great deal on expedia.com (AUD$94 per night). We were on the second floor and had a corner room with a huge wrap-around balcony (would be great to have some furniture on it though!) Hotel is very new and modern with a king-sized bed (zipped-king), big flat screen tv, desk and bed-side tables. Bathroom is a reasonable size with gorgeous fluffy towels and lots of toiletries. Rooms were serviced daily and all linens refreshed. It also had a decent sized safe, a bar fridge and a hanging space for clothes. Only thing missing? A kettle would have been nice. Breakfast was included which you could take in your room, or in the little breakfast area downstairs. Good selection of fruit, a few cereals, croissants, cold meats as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. They also had a cake or tart each day, as well as white sliced bread, (although it tended to be a bit stale for my liking). The best bit was the barrista who made coffees to order for no extra cost! Staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good english. Wireless internet is available, as is a computer in the lobby, however internet access to this must be purchased at reception. The hotel's location is a little out of the centre of the city, but the 90Express bus is the fastest way to get to and from Termini, and takes only about 15 - 20mins. To get to the hotel, get off at Stazione (not the easiest bus stop signs to read from the bus, but you'll see a stand-alone shop on the right behind the bus stop called 'Real Box'. Cross the road directly opposite (there is a bank on the corner), and head down via Tireno for approx 200m to get to the hotel. We ate out a few nights in the local area - out of the hotel and down the street to the left was a nice traditional italian restaurant, and across the road, down to the right was a great little pizza place that does a take-away pizza and a can of drink for 5 euros. If you are staying in Rome for a few nights and want a quality hotel for a great price, you must stay at Hotel Aniene.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel we would stay at again”
Reviews.Author: mourne77s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 ights in mid october. We were on the second floor at the front of the hotel. It had a huge balcony about 4mx4m though no furniture. The room was smallish but spotlesly clean and cleaned every day. it had a minibar and air con and a big wall mounted plasma TV. bathroom was spotless - lots of free toiliteries etc, large very good shower (room for 2!) fresh towels every day. Breakfast was great - they even do bacon and scrambled eggs. Service was very good, friendly, attentive and reception staff all spoke english. The hotel is very crisp and modern. It isnt big but at 80 euros a night B&B for two of us it was an absolute bargain. Would have given 5 but location as a wee drawback. Some flight crews are now using this hotel! The hotel is on a big tree lined road but it is actually very quiet because it is a residential area. 57 tipsy steps from the hotel front door is a half decent italian restaurant serving good food and wine. Most people in it are locals with lots of birthday parties etc. We ate in it 3 of the 4 nights we stayed and calling in at 11pm you will probably still get served. You are certainly living with the locals in the surrounding area and there isn't a big lot to do locally. The neighbourhood felt safe though it isn't the poshest. The only drawback to the place is that is 20 - 30 minutes out of the city centre on express bus which is frequent and cheap. Other reviewers give the bus numbers. Suggest you buy the Roma card (20 euros at Termini only) - three days unlimited travel and access to two sites free we used it at the Collesum and walked straight past the 2 hour queue! If we were staying 1/2 nights we might consider the city centre but would definitely stay here again for any longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsCharners
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weeks stay with my mum and brother at the Hotel Aniene. Though the room was quite small and simple it was uncluttered and very clean and given that we stayed in a triple room it is understandable that there was not much room in the main sleeping area for anything else other than the beds, bedside tables and dressing table. The only thing that was missing from the room was a full lenth mirror though there was a wall mirror in the bathroom. The rooms were cleaned every day, the bed linen was changed, and the toiletries and the towels were replaced. The only complaint here (if you can call it a complaint) is that this was done even when we left a "do not disturb sign" on the door when we went out. The breakfast buffet choice was more than sufficient for us consisting of a choice of two cereals, yogurts, fruit, cakes, croissants, bread with jams and cheese, ham, bacon, scrambled egg and a selection of teas and juices as well as coffee. The front of house staff were very friendly and efficient and were willing to help out whenever required for example booking our excursion, booking us a taxi to the airport. The only issue that we had was that it was further from the city than we expected and you definitely need to either catch a bus or get a taxi in order to reach the city centre. The buses however were very cheap (just one euro per trip or four euros for a day ticket). Overall a vey pleasant stay, just would have been nicer if it had been closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “The bus ride is worthwhile.”
Reviews.Author: shangyung
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Aniene for two nights in late August. The staffs are friendly and helpful. The hotel is very new and the room is clean. The breakfast is well above average. The wireless internet connection is free of charge. While Hotel Aniene is not located near the Historic Center, a 20-minute bus ride from the Termini (Route 90 at the stop Sempione) and a 3-minute walk will take you there.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aniene
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Tirreno, 74, 00141 Rome, Italy
